alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 26 at 2:48PM PDT until March 28 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 11 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Above 3000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Between 2000 and 3000 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches, and 5 to 10 inches on Sawyers Bar west of Etna. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph over high and exposed terrain. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, including areas west and south of Scott Valley above 2000 feet. This also includes Sawyers Bar Road, Highway 3, and portions of Highway 96 west of Klamath River. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 11 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could approach 1 to 2 inches per hour Monday night through Tuesday morning. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent, or likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
